algorithm_technique: Use hash maps to count lamps in rows, columns, and diagonals. Process queries and turn off lamps.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if a cell is illuminated by any lamp, then turn off nearby lamps.
problem_summary_technical: Track lamp counts in rows, columns, and diagonals using hash maps. For each query, check illumination and update counts for adjacent lamps.
key_insights: Efficiently tracking illuminated cells requires counting lamps along rows, columns, and diagonals.
Hash maps are suitable for storing these counts, keyed by row, column, or diagonal identifier.
When a lamp is turned off, its contribution to all affected lines (row, col, diagonals) must be decremented.
